compounddef.basecompoundref: rcppsw::patterns::decorator::decorator< TSpecType::template bgl_view_impl_type< hgrid3D_view_edge_filter_type< TSpecType >, hgrid3D_view_vertex_filter_type< TSpecType > > >

memberdef.type: typename spec_type::template bgl_view_impl_type< hgrid3D_view_edge_filter_type< spec_type >, hgrid3D_view_vertex_filter_type< spec_type > >
memberdef.definition: using rcppsw::ds::graph::hgrid3D_view< TSpecType >::bgl_view_type = typename spec_type::template bgl_view_impl_type< hgrid3D_view_edge_filter_type<spec_type>, hgrid3D_view_vertex_filter_type<spec_type> >
memberdef.name: bgl_view_type

briefdescription.para: The view has to own the data that was used to build it, because the boost::filtered_graph filter functions that were passed by using std::bind() during its construction are evaluated later when iterating over vertices, and if the object the bound functions refer to doesn't exist anymore you will get a segfault at best and undefined behavior at worst.
A view of a hgrid3D using boost::filtered_graph.
